storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive notifications about schedule changes to stay informed

testCases.title: Validate notification display on schedule update
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee has at least one scheduled shift
Admin user has permissions to modify employee schedules
Notification system is enabled and operational
Employee is not currently logged into the portal

steps.action: Admin user logs into the system with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Admin is successfully authenticated and redirected to the admin dashboard

steps.action: Admin navigates to the schedule management section
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management interface is displayed with current employee schedules

steps.action: Admin selects the employee's existing schedule entry
steps.expectedResult: Employee's schedule details are displayed and editable

steps.action: Admin modifies the schedule (e.g., changes shift time from 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM) and saves the changes
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is successfully updated, confirmation message is displayed, and schedule change event is triggered in the system

steps.action: Employee navigates to the portal login page and enters valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the employee dashboard

steps.action: Employee observes the dashboard for notification indicators
steps.expectedResult: Visual notification indicator (e.g., badge, icon, or banner) is prominently displayed indicating new schedule changes

steps.action: Employee clicks on the notification indicator to view notification details
steps.expectedResult: Notification panel opens displaying the schedule change details including date, old time, new time, and change timestamp

steps.action: Employee verifies the notification content matches the schedule change made by admin
steps.expectedResult: Notification shows correct schedule change information: shift time changed from 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM with accurate date and details

postconditions: Notification is displayed in the employee's notification list
Schedule change is reflected in the employee's schedule view
Notification remains unacknowledged until employee takes action
Admin remains logged in to the system

testCases.title: Verify notification acknowledgment process
preconditions: Employee is logged into the portal
Employee has at least one unacknowledged notification in the system
Database is accessible for storing acknowledgment status

steps.action: Employee navigates to the notifications section from the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Notifications panel is displayed showing all unacknowledged notifications with visual indicators

steps.action: Employee locates the schedule change notification and clicks the 'Acknowledge' button
steps.expectedResult: Notification status changes to 'Acknowledged', visual indicator (e.g., checkmark or color change) appears, and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Employee verifies the notification is no longer in the unacknowledged list
steps.expectedResult: Notification is removed from the unacknowledged notifications list or moved to acknowledged section

steps.action: Employee clicks on 'Notification History' or 'View All Notifications' link
steps.expectedResult: Notification history page is displayed showing all notifications including acknowledged and unacknowledged ones

steps.action: Employee locates the previously acknowledged notification in the history
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledged notification is present in the history with 'Acknowledged' status, acknowledgment timestamp, and complete details are visible

steps.action: Employee clicks the logout button to end the current session
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully logged out and redirected to the login page, session is terminated

steps.action: Employee logs back into the portal using valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard

steps.action: Employee navigates to the notification history section
steps.expectedResult: Notification history is displayed with all previous notifications

steps.action: Employee verifies the previously acknowledged notification still shows as acknowledged
steps.expectedResult: Previously acknowledged notification remains marked as 'Acknowledged' with the original acknowledgment timestamp, status persists across sessions

postconditions: Notification acknowledgment status is permanently saved in the database
Notification history accurately reflects all acknowledgment actions
Employee session is active after re-login
No unacknowledged notifications remain for the tested notification

testCases.title: Test notification delivery time
preconditions: Admin user has permissions to modify schedules
Employee account exists with scheduled shifts
System clock is synchronized and accurate
Notification service is running and operational
Employee is ready to log in immediately after schedule update
Timing measurement tool or system logs are available

steps.action: Record the current system timestamp before making any changes
steps.expectedResult: Baseline timestamp is recorded for comparison (e.g., T0 = 10:00:00)

steps.action: Admin logs into the system and navigates to schedule management
steps.expectedResult: Admin is authenticated and schedule management interface is displayed

steps.action: Admin updates the employee's schedule (e.g., adds a new shift or modifies existing shift) and saves the changes
steps.expectedResult: Schedule update is saved successfully, and exact timestamp of the update is recorded (e.g., T1 = 10:00:05)

steps.action: Verify in system logs or database that notification generation event was triggered
steps.expectedResult: Notification record is created in the database with generation timestamp, status shows as 'Pending' or 'Sent'

steps.action: Employee logs into the portal within 30 seconds of the schedule update
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard (e.g., T2 = 10:00:25)

steps.action: Employee immediately checks for notification indicators on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Notification indicator is displayed showing the schedule change notification

steps.action: Employee clicks on the notification to view details and records the notification timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Notification details are displayed with creation timestamp visible (e.g., notification created at 10:00:06)

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between schedule update (T1) and notification generation timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is less than or equal to 60 seconds, meeting the 1-minute SLA requirement

steps.action: Verify in system logs that no delays or errors occurred during notification processing
steps.expectedResult: System logs show successful notification processing with no errors, delays, or retry attempts beyond the 1-minute threshold

postconditions: Notification delivery time is documented and meets SLA of 1 minute or less
Notification is successfully delivered and visible to employee
System logs contain complete audit trail of notification generation and delivery
Schedule update is reflected in employee's schedule view
Performance metrics are recorded for monitoring
